org.jcvi.jillion.assembly

Class AssemblyUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.AssemblyUtil

  • public final class AssemblyUtil
extends Object
    AssemblyUtil is a utility class for working with AssembledReads and gapped NucleotideSequence.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • buildGappedComplementedFullRangeBases

        public static NucleotideSequence buildGappedComplementedFullRangeBases(AssembledRead assembledRead,
                                                                       NucleotideSequence ungappedUncomplementedFullRangeBases)
        Create a NucleotideSequence that corresponds to the gapped full range (untrimmed, uncomplemented, gapped) version of the given AssembledRead. Generally, the returned sequence will be the trimmed off portions of the read (from primer/barcode or bad quality) flanking the gapped sequence from the assembled read (the good quality trimmed sequence returned by AssembledRead.getNucleotideSequence() ).
        Parameters:
        assembledRead - the read to work on.
        ungappedUncomplementedFullRangeBases - the ungapped uncomplemented full (raw) version of the basecalls as originally called from the sequencer.
        Returns:
        a NucleotideSequence of the gapped, untrimmed uncomplemented basecalls of the given read.

      • buildGappedComplementedFullRangeBases

        public static NucleotideSequence buildGappedComplementedFullRangeBases(AssembledRead assembledRead,
                                                                       NucleotideSequence ungappedUncomplementedFullRangeBases,
                                                                       boolean turnOffCompression)
        Create a NucleotideSequence that corresponds to the gapped full range (untrimmed, uncomplemented, gapped) version of the given AssembledRead. Generally, the returned sequence will be the trimmed off portions of the read (from primer/barcode or bad quality) flanking the gapped sequence from the assembled read (the good quality trimmed sequence returned by AssembledRead.getNucleotideSequence() ).
        Parameters:
        assembledRead - the read to work on.
        ungappedUncomplementedFullRangeBases - the ungapped uncomplemented full (raw) version of the basecalls as originally called from the sequencer.
        turnOffCompression - Turn off more extreme data compression when making the resulting NucleotideSequence which will improve cpu performance at the cost of the built NucleotideSequence taking up more memory.
        Returns:
        a NucleotideSequence of the gapped, untrimmed uncomplemented basecalls of the given read.

      • getUngappedComplementedValidRangeQualities

        public static QualitySequence getUngappedComplementedValidRangeQualities(AssembledRead read,
                                                                         QualitySequence fullRangeRawQualities)
        Get the QualitySequence for the given read's VALID RANGE taking direction into account.
        Parameters:
        read - the read; can not be null.
        fullRangeRawQualities - the "raw" quality values returned by the sequencer. These qualities are un-complemented even if the read is reverse.Can not be null.
        Returns:
        a new QualitySequence instance which will be trimmed complemented qualities; will never be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either parameters is null.

      • reverseComplementValidRange

        public static Range reverseComplementValidRange(Range validRange,
                                                long fullLength)
        Reverse Complement the given validRange with regards to its fullLength.
        Parameters:
        validRange - the valid Range to reverseCompliment.
        fullLength - the full length of the untrimmed basecalls.
        Returns:
        a new Range that corresponds to the reverse complemented valid range.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if valid range is larger than fullLength
        NullPointerException - if validRange is null.

      • convertToUngappedFullRangeOffset

        public static int convertToUngappedFullRangeOffset(AssembledRead placedRead,
                                                   int gappedOffset)
        Convert the given gapped valid range offset of a given read into its corresponding ungapped full length (untrimmed) equivalent.
        Parameters:
        placedRead - the read to use in the computation.
        gappedOffset - the gapped offset to convert into an ungapped full range offset.
        Returns:
        the ungapped full range offset as a positive int.

      • getLeftFlankingNonGapIndex

        public static int getLeftFlankingNonGapIndex(NucleotideSequence gappedNucleotides,
                                             int gappedReadIndex)
        Get the first non-gap Nucleotide from the left side of the given gappedReadIndex on the given NucleotideSequence. If the given base is not a gap, then that is the value returned.
        Parameters:
        gappedNucleotides - the gapped nucleotides to search
        gappedReadIndex - the gapped offset (0-based) to start the search from.
        Returns:
        the first non-gap position on the placedRead that is <= gappedReadIndex; may be negative if the sequence starts with gaps.

      • getRightFlankingNonGapIndex

        public static int getRightFlankingNonGapIndex(NucleotideSequence sequence,
                                              int gappedOffset)
        Get the first non-gap Nucleotide from the right side of the given gappedOffset on the given NucleotideSequence. If the given base is not a gap, then that is the value returned.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the gapped NucleotideSequence to search
        gappedOffset - the gapped offset (0-based) to start the search from.
        Returns:
        the first non-gap position on the placedRead that is >= gappedReadIndex

      • toUngappedRange

        public static Range toUngappedRange(NucleotideSequence gappedSequence,
                                    Range gappedRange)
        Get the corresponding ungapped Range (where the start and end values of the range are in ungapped coordinate space) for the given gapped NucleotideSequence and gapped Range.
        Parameters:
        gappedSequence - the gapped NucleotideSequence needed to compute the ungapped coordinates from.
        gappedRange - the Range of gapped coordinates.
        Returns:
        a new Range never null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either argument is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given Range goes beyond the gapped sequence.
